Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
Should not the multitude of words be answered? and should a man full of talk be justified?<RF>full…: Heb. of lips<Rf>
Should thy lies make men hold their peace? and when thou mockest, shall no man make thee ashamed?<RF>lies: or, devices<Rf>
For thou hast said, My doctrine <FI>is<Fi> pure, and I am clean in thine eyes.
But oh that God would speak, and open his lips against thee;
And that he would shew thee the secrets of wisdom, that <FI>they are<Fi> double to that which is! Know therefore that God exacteth of thee <FI>less<Fi> than thine iniquity <FI>deserveth<Fi>.<CM>
Canst thou by searching find out God? canst thou find out the Almighty unto perfection?
<FI>It is<Fi> as high as heaven; what canst thou do? deeper than hell; what canst thou know?<RF>as high…: Heb. the heights of heaven<Rf>
The measure thereof <FI>is<Fi> longer than the earth, and broader than the sea.
If he cut off, and shut up, or gather together, then who can hinder him?<RF>cut…: or, make a change<Rf><RF>hinder…: Heb. turn him away?<Rf>
For he knoweth vain men: he seeth wickedness also; will he not then consider <FI>it<Fi>?
For vain man would be wise, though man be born <FI>like<Fi> a wild ass's colt.<RF>vain: Heb. empty<Rf><CM>
If thou prepare thine heart, and stretch out thine hands toward him;
If iniquity <FI>be<Fi> in thine hand, put it far away, and let not wickedness dwell in thy tabernacles.
For then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; yea, thou shalt be stedfast, and shalt not fear:
Because thou shalt forget <FI>thy<Fi> misery, <FI>and<Fi> remember <FI>it<Fi> as waters <FI>that<Fi> pass away:
And <FI>thine<Fi> age shall be clearer than the noonday; thou shalt shine forth, thou shalt be as the morning.<RF>be clearer…: Heb. shall arise above the noon-day<Rf>
And thou shalt be secure, because there is hope; yea, thou shalt dig <FI>about thee, and<Fi> thou shalt take thy rest in safety.
Also thou shalt lie down, and none shall make <FI>thee<Fi> afraid; yea, many shall make suit unto thee.<RF>make suit…: Heb. intreat thy face<Rf>

But the eyes of the wicked shall fail, and they shall not escape, and their hope <FI>shall be as<Fi> the giving up of the ghost.<RF>they shall…: Heb. flight shall perish from them<Rf><RF>the giving…: or, a puff of breath<Rf><CM>
